bibl.title: Pseudo Script in Gebel el Silsila: Preliminary Results of the 2012 Epigraphic Survey.
bibl.note: Presents a series of quarry marks located on Gebel el Silsila's east bank (from five individual quarries), foremost dating to the Ptolemaic and Roman Periods [including Greek alphabetic letters].

bibl.title: "Current Research in Egyptology 2013. Proceedings of the Fourteenth Annual Symposium, University of Cambridge, United Kingdom, March 19-22, 2013."

bibl.seg: Maria Nilsson, Pseudo Script in Gebel el Silsila: Preliminary Results of the 2012 Epigraphic Survey.

Kelly Accetta, Renate Fellinger, Pedro Lourenço Gonçalves, Sarah Musselwhite & Paul van Pelt (edd.), Current Research in Egyptology 2013. Proceedings of the Fourteenth Annual Symposium, University of Cambridge, United Kingdom, March 19-22, 2013 (Oxford - Philadelphia, 2014) pp. 122-141, 19 figg.
Presents a series of quarry marks located on Gebel el Silsila's east bank (from five individual quarries), foremost dating to the Ptolemaic and Roman Periods [including Greek alphabetic letters].
